page.title: 05HOUSING
page.content: The majority of the houses are situated along the coastroad, east of Rampside and in linear formation. All the houses have electricity but there is no gas supply despite having a gas terminal close at hand. The houses vary tremendously in age, from mid-nineteenth century to present ones under construction. Some of the accommodation along the coast road are used as holiday chalets and remain vacant during the winter months. The type of house varies considerably from small terraced cottages to large detached residences. As one approaches Rampside from Roose there are five detached houses in close proximity to each other. The vicarage and Eastwood Cottage date back to the 1840's, with the foremost being a school until 1892. Eastwood Cottage has an interesting coach house with some of
